TextView.android:text: No correct grammar exists! Commas and periods mark only the rhythm. The examples in each card appear in type like they sound.

Pirate is an eighteenth century English Cockney rhythmic slang, like, “Ye b, a flea ridden, scurvy cur!” Many comments are light hearted insults along with extravagant interchangeable compounded phrases, which bring unique color, and enhances the fun.

The speaking rhythm is highly repetitive along with the word, “be”. Speaking slowly, exaggerating the accent, with a gravelly voice, along with the use of many very colorful words will bring more fun! Yarr?
